segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 13. Gahapativagga
segments.en: 13. Householders

segments.pli: 124. Vesālīsutta
segments.en: 124. At Vesālī

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

segments.pli: Atha kho uggo gahapati vesāliko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho uggo gahapati vesāliko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Ugga of Vesālī went up to the Buddha, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
segments.en: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?

segments.pli: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
segments.en: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?”

segments.pli: “Santi kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: “Householder, there are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them, their consciousness relies on that and grasps it.

segments.pli: Saupādāno, gahapati, bhikkhu no parinibbāyati … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished.

segments.pli: santi kho, gahapati, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them, their consciousness relies on that and grasps it.

segments.pli: Saupādāno, gahapati, bhikkhu no parinibbāyati.
segments.en: A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, gahapati, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life.

segments.pli: Santi ca kho, gahapati, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati. Tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti, na tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them, their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it.

segments.pli: Anupādāno, gahapati, bhikkhu parinibbāyati … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.

segments.pli: santi kho, gahapati, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi kho, gahapati, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato. Na tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti, na tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them, their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it.

segments.pli: Anupādāno, gahapati, bhikkhu parinibbāyati.
segments.en: A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, gahapati, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī,…

suttaplex.blurb: At the Great Wood, the householder Ugga of Vesālī asks the Buddha why some become awakened in this very life, while others do not.
